head.title: Jocelyn A. Awad, Randall B. Evans

hedline.hl1: Jocelyn A. Awad, Randall B. Evans

block.p: Jocelyn Ann Awad, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Phillip P. Awad of Weston, Mass., was married there on Thursday to Dr. Randall Brian Evans, the son of Mr. and Mrs. W. Doyle Evans of Los Alamos, N.M. The Rev. Dr. Thomas D. Wintle officiated at the First Parish Unitarian Church.
Mrs. Evans, 36, is a social worker in the thoracic surgery division of Brigham and Women's Hospital in Boston, where Dr. Evans, 32, is a fellow in pulmonary medicine.

Jocelyn Ann Awad, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Phillip P. Awad of Weston, Mass., was married there on Thursday to Dr. Randall Brian Evans, the son of Mr. and Mrs. W. Doyle Evans of Los Alamos, N.M. The Rev. Dr. Thomas D. Wintle officiated at the First Parish Unitarian Church.
Mrs. Evans, 36, is a social worker in the thoracic surgery division of Brigham and Women's Hospital in Boston, where Dr. Evans, 32, is a fellow in pulmonary medicine.

The bride graduated from Dartmouth College and received a master's degree in social work from Simmons College. Her father, now retired, was the owner of the Ward Weller Company, a manufacturer of aluminum railings in Hudson, Mass.

The bridegroom graduated magna cum laude from Trinity University in San Antonio and received his medical degree from the University of New Mexico. His father, an astrophysicist, retired as the leader of the earth and space science division of the Los Alamos National Laboratory and is now a professor of physics at the University of Oklahoma in Tulsa. The bridegroom's mother, Carolyn Evans, retired as an upper elementary teacher at the Barranca Mesa School in Los Alamos.
The bridegroom's first marriage ended in divorce. WEDDINGS
